abstract: A talk show featuring Rosie O’Donnell and a series of old episodes of “The Oprah Winfrey Show” are intended to revitalize a network that has gotten off to a slow start.
snippet: A talk show featuring Rosie O’Donnell and a series of old episodes of “The Oprah Winfrey Show” are intended to revitalize a network that has gotten off to a slow start.
lead_paragraph: Oprah Winfrey’s 10-month-old cable channel had a reset of sorts on Monday with the introduction of “The Rosie Show,” a 7 p.m. talk show by Rosie O’Donnell, and “Oprah’s Lifeclass,” a remix of old episodes of “The Oprah Winfrey Show,” at 8 p.m.

headline.main: Two New Shows on Oprah Winfrey Network
